[[2x\sin(x) + x^2\cos(x)]\]

This follows from applying the product rule to \(f(x) = x^2\sin(x)\) and \(g(x) = x\), resulting in \(f(x) \cdot g'(x) + f'(x) \cdot g(x)\). However, to ensure accuracy, re-calculating using the direct operation rule:

Given \(f(x) = x^2\sin(x)\) and \(g(x) = x\), the operation \(f△g\) results in:

\((f(g(x)))'\) 

equals

\((f(x))'\) when \(x = g(x)\), hence

\((f(x))' = (x^2\sin(x))'\)

\[= 2x\sin(x) + x^2\cos(x)\]

So, the corrected answer in LaTeX format is: [[2x\sin(x) + x^2\cos(x)]]
